title: Rational End Behavior - degrees of polynomials

content.question: ​The rational function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x to the power of k open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses over denominator x to the power of 5 plus 2 x minus 5 end fraction"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>k</mi></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>, where <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> is a positive integer. For which of the following values of <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> will the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> have a horizontal asymptote at <math alttext="y equals 0"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
